channel.title: RAM vs. Processor vs. Players
channel.description:
At this moment, I have a 1.8GHz processor with 512MB of RAM. My max amount of players on my server was about 40 until I got some lag. I was wondering if I had 1.8GHz processor and 1GB of RAM, would that bring me about to about 100 players? Can someone please tell me why more RAM would allow me to have more players? I know that a better processor would, because it would allow my computer to be faster, but how does RAM get into the picture?
Thanks, Play For Keeps

item.title: RAM vs. Processor vs. Players
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:28, topic:159520”]You guys are sad for flaming each other. Really.

95% of everyone who posted on this topic do not even understand the basics of one language. Yes, that includes Java. It may seem like it’s easy calling methods like addItem() all the time, but it’s not like that. Somebody before you actually made that method. They took their time to write it up, and you just sit there claiming it as your own.

Private Server ‘Coding’ is nothing close to the real language of Java. RS Client Hacking requires 100x more knowledge than needed to program a Private Server. Well, atleast that’s true on these forums. (And it’s different when you program a server from scratch. I’m talking about all of you who use methods made before you as a base.)

Guess what? I’m 13. I don’t care. I’m proud I know a lot more than most MoparScapers on this forum. It may not seem like it. But it does to me, and I know for a fact I’m right about it.

Other facts:
HTML is a markup language.
CSS is just styling. I dont consider it a ‘language’
Java is a real language, although not as hard as languages like C++
JavaScript is just an easier version of Java for web-side programming

Main point:
Stop it with the flaming about knowledge on programming languages. Yes, lots of people on these forums do not know much, but they’re all here to learn something new. We all started somewhere. Either if it was from Javadocs or Private Servers. I learned from Private Servers. They helped me learn the basic structure of a Java program (mIRC Scripting helped as well).

I think I got my point across. o.0[/quote]
Yup. You did.

Read full topic

They took their time to write it up, and you just sit there claiming it as your own.

Private Server ‘Coding’ is nothing close to the real language of Java. RS Client Hacking requires 100x more knowledge than needed to program a Private Server. Well, atleast that’s true on these forums. (And it’s different when you program a server from scratch. I’m talking about all of you who use methods made before you as a base.)

Guess what? I’m 13. I don’t care. I’m proud I know a lot more than most MoparScapers on this forum. It may not seem like it. But it does to me, and I know for a fact I’m right about it.

Other facts:
HTML is a markup language.
CSS is just styling. I dont consider it a ‘language’
Java is a real language, although not as hard as languages like C++
JavaScript is just an easier version of Java for web-side programming

Main point:
Stop it with the flaming about knowledge on programming languages. Yes, lots of people on these forums do not know much, but they’re all here to learn something new. We all started somewhere. Either if it was from Javadocs or Private Servers. I learned from Private Servers. They helped me learn the basic structure of a Java program (mIRC Scripting helped as well).

I think I got my point across. o.0

item.title: RAM vs. Processor vs. Players
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

hippie:

Yz is just another mitb person trying to look cool for his fellow members by flaming people. I laugh at him becuase it’s pointless, he trys to look so big over the internet, and it just amuses me.

Not really. I don’t try to look big… I just put my head down and program to the best of the ability.

[quote=“Play For Keeps, post:14, topic:159520”]Do you want to bet? I know languages in Java, CSS, SMF, HTML, XML, I can program (if I already haven’t) clients, search engines, what ever I want. Do you know how many job offers I have right now? Making a Private RS2 server is something that I can do when I’m done with class.

EDIT: and thanks hippie[/quote]
HTML isn’t a language, it is a markup.
CSS is piss easy. SMF isn’t even a language I don’t think. XML is a markup.
If you can program, then why do you suck at Java. If you were any good at it you would use at least basic OOP within your code.

Read full topic
